content.question: Which of the following diagrams best represents the contour of the entire vocal melody?

choices.label: A line drawing of the contour of a melody. A straight horizontal line moves up slightly, dips lower, and raises to its highest point at the end. After a space this contour is repeated.
A line drawing of the contour of a melody. A straight horizontal line moves up drastically, suddenly dips low, and then drops lower. After a space this contour is repeated.
A line drawing of the contour of a melody. A horizontal line dips very low, suddenly moves higher, and stays at this level before a slight drop at the end. After a space this contour is repeated.

A line drawing of the contour of a melody. A straight horizontal line dips briefly and returns to its original position, dips lower, travels up, and returns to the lower position. After a space this contour is repeated.

content.answer: A line drawing of the contour of a melody. A straight horizontal line dips briefly and returns to its original position, dips lower, travels up, and returns to the lower position. After a space this contour is repeated.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
